title: Why the new generation of military-inspired watches is hitting the mark
text:
With its dial and rubber strap in dusty olive green, the version of Patek Philippe's sporty Aquanaut, launched at the Baselworld watch fair in March must be the watchmaker's first ever model to appear suited to the wrist of a special forces combatant. Never mind that it's cased in white gold: it joins a brotherly band of watches in which the gleaming tones of traditional luxury have been rejected for something that's fundamentally more battle-ready.
